author: Jamie Bee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2021
review_content: While the author does engage in a little too much info-dumping occasionally for my liking, she starts the book with a pivotal moment in the heroine's life, when she learns that her biological father—whom she's never met—left her an inheritance in Tuscany. This sets her world on edge, and nothing will be quite the same again. After the heroine goes to Tuscany, the author peels back the layers of the heroine's mother's life during that fateful summer in Italy in the mid-1980s as well as shows its rippling effects and consequences far into the future, including legal and emotional battles. I love well-done dual plotlines that seamlessly pirouette together, the happenings in one shedding light on the other. The author's descriptions of Italy, and particularly the food, put you right there. Fiction is a great way to armchair travel (our best travel option during this time of global crisis), and this one helps you do so while engaging you with the many tangled vines of the story. As the lies and secrets get untangled, we come to see that the story is not only about a profound love but also regret, healing, and forgiveness. A gripping and heartfelt read.I received a free copy of this book, but that did not affect my review.
title: Armchair Travel To Tuscany, Past and Present

author: Anne R. Marshall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2021
review_content: These Tangled Vines by Julianne MacClean is a soul-touching drama taking place in two time periods.  It feature Kate Bell whose mother died 12 years ago, when she was 18. At that time she took over responsibility for her father, who is a quadriplegic and needed round-the-clock care. On her deathbed, Lillian, Kate's mother, confessed that she had been fathered by a man other than her husband, Fred Bell. She also made her promise to never tell Fred: it would devastate him. So she had soldiered on, sacrificing many things that normal people had, all to care for her father. One day she got devastating news: her natural father, Anton Clark, had died and had left her property. Could she come to Italy? It turns out that he was a fabulously wealthy man. He owned multiple homes as well as this lovely vineyard near Tuscany. He had split the other things, as well as some money between his two other children, but he had left the vineyard and wine production to her, as well as a load of cash. She didn't know what to think. Her half-siblings were not happy, and really, not very nice. She still had her father to think of. What would she do with an Italian vineyard? Her half-brother, Connor, was threatening to try to break the will. There was no proof that he had really meant her to have all this, unless they could find the letters that were supposedly here somewhere, from her mother.Thirty years earlier there had been love and tragedy. Lillian had married Freddie five years earlier because she had been pregnant and then she lost the baby. He was writing a novel and promised the minute he wrote, "The End." They would get pregnant. It was to take place in Tuscany so she suggested they go there for the summer. She could find a job and he could write. So they did. Her life changed. She loved the winery and the vineyards and the owner. There was a brief affair but she felt so guilty: a bout cheating on Freddie and about loving Anton. She was a strong character who knew what was right and did it. Fred was the one: the weak one, who held on, thinking only of himself, before the accident and after. But they had a beautiful daughter, Kate. One they both loved with their whole hearts. He had been in that chair for over two years. The doctors had said it would only be a couple of years before an infection of some sort took him. They all: Lillian, Fred, Anton, and Kate, lived this lie for over thirty years. Now, both Lillian and Anton were dead. And Kate knew the truth. She also had a great many decisions to make, decisions that would affect her father her sibling, the employees of the vineyard. She was devastated. This book had me at the edge of tears, nose stuffed up for the last half of it. The beginning was hard because I was waiting for bad things to happen. Then they had and I could move on. Gut-wrenching, soul-stealing. What a beautiful book!I was invited to read a free e-ARC of These Tangled Vines by MacClean's ARC team and Netgalley. All thoughts and opinions are my own. #netgalley #thesetangledvines
title: I was angry. I cried. I blushed. What a book!

author: Katherine M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2021
review_content: This book is well written but I do think it lost momentum and unfortunately made the antagonist too villainy. This book starts off very well with Fiona surprised to find out she’s named in a will and needs to travel to Italy to find out more. The pacing was quick and Fiona made a great character to watch the family drama unfold as her new found relatives are shocked by her inclusion at all in the will. Unfortunately the perspective then shifts between present day and flashbacks of the past. By their very nature the flashbacks have an inevitably tragic end that hangs over them. Fiona and the reader also find out who the real villain in the story is which I found to be quite appalling. It’s really an anti-love story that’s too tragic. It’s an interesting unveiling but Fiona becomes too full of platitudes about forgiveness that annoyed me as she was so unreal. I think the story lost its momentum and the characters became too one sided.

author: M. Bass
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2021
review_content: When she was 18, Kate Bell was told a startling secret by her mother, Lillian, who was on her deathbed.  The man she thought was her father, Fred, the man that had loved and raised her, even while being a quadriplegic, wasn’t really her father at all.  Her father was Anton Clark, a man she had fallen in love with years earlier while working at a vineyards in Italy, while Fred was writing the book that would later become a best seller. Lillian asked that she keep the secret because she believed that Fred wouldn’t be able to handle it, so Kate did. Then she got a call early one morning from Italy saying that Anton had passed but as she was named in the will she needed to make it to Tuscany as soon as possible. Kate arrived with so many questions in her head of why had it happened, she definitely didn’t expect some of the others she got. Let alone being named as the heir to the vineyards and estate that was worth over 100 million Euros.  His children, Connor and Solange, were not exactly happy with it, sure they had gotten property and several million in cash each, they had just figured they would get it. After all didn’t he owe it to them for being the cheating tyrant father that they hadn’t spoken to in awhile. Was he really that? Or was he a loving man whose ex wife just painted that way? Were the letters between Anton and Lillian hidden away somewhere proof for Connor that she was blackmailing him?? Or would they show that they were truly a couple in love? That the reason Kate was left the estate because he knew she would run it like he had when he met her mother that fateful summer?  Would the memories made that summer by Lillian and Anton come back to life and show their daughter why she was kept a secret?Now I will admit there are a few paragraphs or pages I skipped here and there just because it seemed to go on a bit too long. But other than that it was a truly a book that you add to your TBR list and enjoy when you have the time because you won’t want to put it down. It will take you to Italy, it will talk about secrets held for years, it will talk about true love, and so much more.

author: anne
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021
review_content: This is a compelling, fascinating story that goes between different time frames, spanning about 30 years.  On her Mother's deathbed, Fiona who is  18, is told that her Dad that she loves and who raised her isn't actually her biological father.  Her Mother asks that she keep the information secret, promising to never to tell her Dad because it could kill him.  As the result of an accident causing a spinal cord injury before she was born Fiona's Dad is a paraplegic and needs 24/7 care.Twelve years have gone by and Fiona has kept the deathbed confession to herself.  She lives with her Dad, where caregivers come and go 24/7.  Fiona has a job, but still struggles to keep up with the expenses incurred by her Dad's many health issues.Early one morning the ringing of her phone is about to change the course of her life.  It is a law office in Italy advising that her father had suddenly died of a heart attack and she is named as a beneficiary in his will.  Although it's short notices, Fiona is asked to appear in Italy within a few days for the reading of the will. She has never met this man so is surprised to be named in his will.When Fiona arrives in Italy, her adventure begins where both her parents had lived years before.  She also learn about the man whose genes she carries.  I was enthralled with this story from the first page and could hardly put it down until the last page was turned.
title: Compelling Fascinating Story

author: LoraDBU
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
review_content: These Tangled Vines is an engrossing tale and one which I could not put down.  The story of Fiona Bell and her journey to find out who she is will keep you on the edge of your seat. Fiona wakes up to a phone call informing her she needs to fly to Italy as her father, Anton Clark, has passed away.  Fiona knows the man she grew up with is not her biological father but she must keep this secret a little longer.  When Fiona arrives in Tuscany the adventure begins with twists and turns in every chapter.  She finds out her mother, Lillian had quite the romantic tryst with Anton, all the while fighting to remain faithful to the husband who all but ignored her in every way.  Fiona's half sister and brother, Sloane and Connor, are not thrilled to meet her, especially after the reading of Anton's will. It doesn't take long for Sloane to see what a blessing it is to have a sister.  Connor on the other hand is greedy to possess his father's fortune.  Fiona and Lillian are amazing women you'll fall in love with as you untangle the story.  Julianne's writing is so exquisite I could almost smell the wonderful Italian dishes as they gathered around a table and taste the wine produced on Anton's Vineyards. I've only read 2 other books twice: "The Good Earth" and "Memoirs of a Geisha". "These Tangled Vines" will be included in that list!  I love all of Julianne's book's but this one is my favorite.  I was invited to read a free ARC of These Tangled Vines by MaClean's ARC team. All thoughts and opinions are my own.

Even though I knew what was gonna happen I was still incredibly engaged. The author world and all three characters that we followed really beautifully. Historically, this has happened repeatedly among those who have engaged in similar circumstances.The story also details livung functionally, among the dysfunctional ; not gettung caught up in it when choosing that path could cost one everything.I love the author 's subtle character development. author: Mindo'ermatter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2021
review_content: This story is about love, hate, commitment, lies, promises, betrayal, redemption, and family. Set primarily in Tuscany, Italy, this emotional story, with the exception of one chapter, is told through through the eyes of three different women (Fiona, Lillian, and Sloane), discovering and explaining their relationship with one mysterious man, Anton, who loved them all, one as a lover, the other two as their father by different women.Because this story is about relationships, the well-crafted dialogues brings the story to life as characters struggle to know who they really are and what they truly want, while desperately seeking happiness that never comes as they expected it.Although described as a romance, this is not a superficial love story but rather a poignant and deeply emotional journey of sibling conflicts, marital challenges, and personal misunderstandings. The basic plot at first seems a little familiar but quickly takes on a less predictable path with an uncertain future. Although a good escape binge read, this novel can be enjoyed nicely in shorter installments without losing continuity.I found myself enjoying the ending more than I anticipated because it seemed realistic and honest. The emphasis on food and wine enjoyment creates a fun backstory without becoming gluttonous.The chapters are labeled with the names of characters telling the story and years, when needed, making it easy to rotate storyline perspectives. The Audible narration supplement worked well with tasteful drama and intonations that enhanced my reading with appropriate character interpretations.This author is one in will definitely consider again.This was my first Julianne MacLean novel, and I was not disappointed. The author creates a compelling storyline filled with interesting and complex people worth knowing and understanding. I appreciated the high-quality writing that made the story memorable, while avoiding offensive language and explicit too often exploited by unimaginative writers.
title: Two Fathers, One Daughter, Big Problems!

author: Patsy Packer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021
review_content: My "headline" is actually describing many of the characters in this book- -not only the book itself!  I found the human interest angles the most compelling part of the book- -not where a city is located or a beach towel lies on the sand! Unless I am specifically reading for geographical reasons, it won't change the characters. Fiona was cheated out of so much as was her mother by a man who couldn't face life alone as a very incapacitated shell of his previous life. I found the judgements made about people to be very real as we make these each and every day and often never take the time to discover if we are basing them on any reality.  Fiona's mother had a real gift and shared it within Anton's business to make him even more successful in the American market.  Children grow up believing what they are told by a "loving" parent only to find out (with regrets) that they were given a terrible piece of non-truth- -reality today as well!!!???  I enjoyed discovering these personalities, challenges, gifts of one to another and compassion .  I personally really enjoyed this book and look forward to more of this author.
title: Don't Judge a Book (anyone) by It's Cover(opinions)!

author: C. Cronk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021
review_content: I so enjoyed this book.  The author did an excellent job of painting the Tuscan scenery and the characters' passion for wine and the land. You could feel the heartache coming off the pages as Lillian made the difficult choices in her life and Anton's devotion and love for her. I felt like a participant at the dinners on the terrazzo taking in the view and the food as described by Maclean.I found it difficult to have any sympathy at all for Fred who spent his life manipulating people to feed his own insecurities -- but he was an important character to the plot. And most importantly, it created tension in the book as his lies and conniving kept first Lillian and then Fiona tethered with guilt about his wellbeing.Excellent read and lots of life lessons. Live and love well and without regret because you cannot go back.
title: Beautiful story of enduring love and the price of secrets

author: Bichons & Books
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021
review_content: The descriptions of the land and its people were lovely. The story was nicely developed. Some of the characters were redeemed by the end.Spoiler aheadSpoiler aheadSpoiler aheadThe milquetoast husband was so overtly selfish, focused on me me me me, that he ignored his wife in order to fulfill his need to write the great novel.  Making him disabled as the story continued did nothing to make me feel anything emotional for the character. Had nothing happened to the husband, and had the main character not falling in love, I'm sure she would have divorced her husband. Penance and guilt are very strong things.
title: An enjoyable story (spoiler ahead)

author: S. Chortwortly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021
review_content: This book is not about Italy, as such, it is about people and their lives of love, hate, happiness and sadness - I hasten to say that she brings the setting to life, she has the reader walking along the paths of the vineyard, working  amongst the vines, looking out over the beauty of the property , and feeling the cool breeze as they stroll  paths flanked by trees.  There are times that one is enveloped in sadness and sacrifice, then  there are times when one is lifted up in the joy and deep love of the characters and of their love and appreciation for the beauty of the word in which they live.  It is an outstanding book.
title: Loved it!

author: Irwin Forman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021
review_content: This book featured a winery near  Florence, Italy. The theme centered on a very wealthy man and who would inherit his various properties. There appeared to be major conflicts amongst the characters that were vividly described. Writing seemed good. Unfortunately the topic did not hold my interest. I guess many other readers will like it. Will probably read more by this author if there are other subjects.
title: Who will inherit?

author: Tripower53
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021
review_content: 302 pages3 starsThe characters in this book were decidedly unlikable, except perhaps the servants. Connor was a money-grubbing creep, Chloe was so mired in her own disappointment she could only intermittently pay attention to her children and Fiona was awfully naive for someone her age. She was too good to be true; to take to Chloe the way she did and offer to give her 500,000 (or whatever) pounds to buy out her half of the London house. To someone you just met? Give me a break.The premise of this book was good, but the characters were awful. Perhaps the next book will be better.
title: Good premise, lousy characters

author: C. O'leary
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021
review_content: 3.5 stars, rounded up, due to the inspiring, philosophical ending of an interesting tale, set in Tuscany mostly, and who can quarrel with that?? Good characters and a lovely setting make this novel an interesting read. The story grows on you as it unfolds, but mostly the setting is the main character. I sometimes had small criticisms of MacLean’s writing style—almost like journalism in some paragraphs, not so inspiring, but then she compensates beautifully in other parts of the book. Worth reading for sure, especially if you’re more in the mood for a romance novel than for literary fiction.
title: These Tangled Vines

author: GeeJay12
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2021
review_content: This is a heartbreaking beautiful and poignant love story. Julianne weaves a story that draws you in, makes you see and literally feel that you are a part of every scene...you taste every mouthful of heavenly wine...feel every tear that is shed...and feel the breaking of every heart...and the sense of loss that permeated Fiona's soul that she never got to meet Anton, her father. You also feel the strength and abiding love she gains for Tuscany.I am so glad that I chose this novel as my "early release" book for May and I will look for every new release from Julianne. Bravissimo!
title: Beautiful story!!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021
review_content: What a wonderful story of meeting your true love your SOULMATE! But then you you are  unable to commit to it. Why, you are trapped in a committed marriage tell death do you part.In the glow of this Love you think it all will work out.  Then the reality hits.Julianne hits the marks with all her characters and situations. I felt I could relate to Lily as I have a similar marriage , my husband has a mental problem  + alcohol issue. And I suffer with MS, Lupus, RA and many other medical issues. So I can relate feeling trapped I could barely put the book down.Thank you so much.
title: Lost summer love

author: BKLYN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2021
review_content: Tuscany...wine...food - lots of it, big inviting table, always room for one more. Family...always room for one more? Maybe, maybe not. Tuscan vineyards, owned and run by one family, passed down generation to generation over centuries. What happens when the next generation decides to change that dynamic? When the next generation includes a surprise participant? How did all of this come about, creating indeed a tangled family? The mystery of the family is a good story, made more interesting by the spectacular location, the beauty of Tuscany, its wines, its food. Indulge yourself!
title: Untangling the vines

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
review_content: This was a fantastic read! Fiona's birth father has died in Tuscany. She has never met him and has kept the secret for years from the father who raised her. Now she is going to the reading of the will. Her half brother and sister will be there so she does not know what to expect. To all the surprise of all of them Anton has left his winery to Fiona as well as his home in Tuscany. She has no idea what the relationship of her mother and Anton was so she investigates to find out. There is a beautiful love story she never knew. You might need a tissue for this one.
title: A tissue might help.

author: Gerry Krag
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2021
review_content: One of the major characters in this novel compares marriage to a Conestoga wagon with the man and wife being the horses, pulling  the responsibilities in that wagon: home, jobs, children, etc. The two pulling the wagon have to share the load and when one lets go , leaving the responsibility to the other, the relationship becomes unworkable. In life, it is often easy for one person to become the caretaker of the relationship, but this is an unhealthy choice, as this story documents. A good read, with interesting glimpses of life on an Italian winery in Tuscany.
title: An interesting look at relationships

author: Kathy Vandergriff
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2021
review_content: I'm so glad I chose this book as the May First Reads choice.  Fiona gets a notice that she needs to go Tuscany, Italy for the reading of a will. To her surprise,  the will benefits his children and she discovers she is one of his children! The story goes back and forth between the time period when Fiona's mother met her dad and the present time. I won't give away what the will gave to Fiona and her half brother and sister. I highly recommend this story to learn about the love story between Fiona's parents.  I plan to read more by this author.
title: Loved this romance set in Tuscany

author: becky A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
review_content: This is the second book I have read by this author and I can honestly say they both found a place in my heart.  The forbidden love of two people and their broken hearts because they could never be together, had my own heart breaking for them. The amazingly beautiful descriptions of the Italian region of Tuscany made me feel as those I was there with them the entire time. This author has an incredible talent for writing and making you feel a part of this entire story.You would be foolish to pass up the opportunity to read anything by this author.
title: The beautiful love of Tuscany

author: SharonSuds
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2021
review_content: The setting is Tuscany when a young couple arrive from the States.  The husband is a writer who plans to use the backdrop of Florence and Paris in his story.The wife finds temporary work at a winery and falls in love with the country, the people and more.Fast forward thirty years.  Their daughter receives notice she's been included in a will from one whose passed in Italy.  And secrets are unraveled.A very interesting story with intertwining decades of events.  This reader highly recommends it.
title: Magnificent Tuscan love story

author: Lindy Lou
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2021
review_content: This is a well plotted book with characters fleshed out and always moving ahead. The “but” is that neither the author nor the editor made the effort to learn the Tallahassee is neither on the Gulf coast nor has high rise hotels. I have lived in Tallahassee for 40 years, and I can reassure the writer, reader and editor that Destin and Panama City are such places. Oops and My Bad... this started the book off as not just a fairy tale but also as a lie. Seems easy enough to look up the location on the map. You gotta be kidding me!
title: Recommend With a Bug But...

author: Wanda L. Meadows
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2021
review_content: I am sure I am joined by most readers of novels when I say I want stories about people—all the ups and downs, the joys and sorrows.  This book has it all, and is well written. When it began with a woman going to a fortieth high school reunion, my first reaction was, “Oh, no! Not another flashback book that seems to be the current fashion!”  I’m talking the kind that yank you back an forth by a few decades. Bless her! She did it like I was taught. Keep in current times and let any remembrance of the past be in the minds of the characters.  She did it very skillfully.Roger Meadows(family account)
title: A satisfying read

author: The Hummels
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2021
review_content: *** spoiler alert***Adultery? Betrayal of a perfectly fine, loving husband who has no idea she's unhappy? What a downturn !! Deleting this book promptly ! Just made me sick to my stomach that mom could deliberately harm her husband until she feels guilty enough to stay. Are there any moral characters in good books these days? I'm not looking for the Scarlet Letter .....but a man with a soul would be great!Also, I kept reading assuming the book would improve..... it didn't.
title: I assumed a surprise ending..... nope!

author: Robin Killingbeck
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2021
review_content: I picked this one with my First Reads last month and finished in two nights. I don't like mysteries but this was the only book that caught my eye in the group of six. In fact, I did not even know it was a mystery until just now checking out her other books. I am going to read more of her books asap, just downloaded 5 of them right now and then will go on to her Unlimited books. Great writer and she made me feel good about all the people in the book, including the selfish dad and half-brother.
title: Wonderful Book, Will read all of her books now.

author: Laura L
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
review_content: This book is so lovely it's hard to explain. The setting, the characters, the heart wrenching romance! I would dearly love to find out if it has a sequel. This one is so good I would love to see a movie made of it.  The characters were so real that I felt I was right there with them. I can imagine myself in Tuscany living this life. The author has a profound way with plot and setting. Fantastic work. I won't tell the ending, you'll have to see for yourself. This is one of my new favorites!
title: Wonderful book!

author: Craig W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021
review_content: I liked that everyone was a shade of grey, except for the brother and his mother.Tuscany was the right place to set this story, because the reader can get lost in the countryside, as well as the characters.The story doesn't take long to read, but I'm glad I took this choice for a 'First Read' book.
title: Enjoyable read, not a lot of suspense, but you can get invested

author: PB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2021
review_content: I have newly discovered this author and I really like her.  This book was good worth your time but IMHO the ending stinks!  The storyline centers on a trip to Tuscany which results in love trust deception lies. The format is the ever poplar present to past, past to present which IMHO is being way over done in today's books. As I stated before this book is worth your time it's a great beach read but it's not the caliber of her other book A Fire Sparkling which I highly recommend !
title: Good Read Lousy Ending

author: Mainer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2021
review_content: Easy beach read that was just okay, maybe even a little disappointing. It reminded me a lot of The Tuscan Child but that was a much better book. The characters were all pretty bland or else caricatures.  The premise was unrealistic and I really hated Freddie (I'm convinced he threw himself in front of the car just because he thought that would keep his wife with him).Hmm, now that I've read my review I think I'll change this from 3 stars to 2; it seems more appropriate.
title: Not great

author: kcg
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021
review_content: This is the 3rd Julianne MacLean novel I've read.  I've given all 3  5-star ratings.  I especially loved this story.  The characters were very flawed however tremendous depth. The plot.  The setting: Italy and Tuscany.Explicit details of the property, vineyards, the family members and loyal long -time staff  transported me to another time and another place.  I'd love to say more but I don't want to do a spoiler alert.  And no smut language.  Thank you.
title: Another Outstanding Novel from Julianne MacLean

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2021
review_content: I love family sagas and this one was wonderful !  The characters were believable and I fell in love with each one. It was refreshing to read a romance novel that did NOT have explicit sex even though there was romance. I'm anxious to read another one of  Julianne MacLean's novels.😊
title: I didn't want  it to  end !

author: Mary
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021
review_content: A lovely book with well developed characters who exhibit the many sides of humanity from greed and jealousy to devoted love and forgiveness. I loved the beautiful descriptions of Tuscany and could imagine myself there, speaking with the people, eating delicious foods and of course drinking the best wines. It kept my interest and I was always eager to see where it would lead. I felt the alternating time periods were the perfect approach for this novel. Great read!
title: A beautiful romantic story with a bit of mystery

author: Leslie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
review_content: I really enjoyed reading this months First Read book.  As I read it, I experienced many emotions. This was a complex love story told from multiple points of view over a long period of time. The author did an awesome job taking us to Italy as the characters explored the wonderful wine, food, and people that make that such a beautiful country. There were life lessons to be learned, incredible sacrifices, and forgiveness tangled up in this amazing love story.
title: Loved this tangled novel!

author: kathyd
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021
review_content: This book has stayed with me. It offers a beautiful and heart wrenching love story that is hard to forget, with unique characters and a setting that is enviable. The storyline isn't as predictable as one would expect and resulted in a good read. I refuse to review a book by giving away much (don't you want to scream when reviewers tell the entire story?!!) but I was tempted to reread the book as soon as I completed it and that rarely happens.
title: wonderful story

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2021
review_content: Thought since it takes place in Tuscany it would be more exciting.  Just disappointing and the big secret was predictable.
title: Sappy love story

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2021
review_content: I think 3 and a half might be my true rating. I wish that every book lately can't just tell a straightforward story without skipping between past and present. The strongest thing and most intriguing is the love story. I would have felt closer to Fiona if I read first person present tense how she interacted with Freddie her father. I could picture Conner and Sloan but Fiona never seemed quite real to me and she is the main character.
title: Life

author: Suzan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2021
review_content: I so enjoyed this book. It was a prime book from Amazon this month. I had read "A Curve in the Road" also written by Julianne MacLean and loved that book too. So when I saw this I knew I had to read it. The book takes you on the life of Fiona Bell but Fiona knows very little and what she thinks she does know is incorrect. We go along and discover as she does. Julianne MacLean once again has a great story and she tells it so well.
title: Great book

author: Linda L. Borgstrom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2021
review_content: This is a story about a young woman who is invited to Italy for the reading of a will.  I thought the book was well written and each chapter gives the story of different characters.  We learn how the daughter is engaging with her "new" family although they aren't too pleased with her.  She also wants to find out the relationship with her mother to the man who fathered her.  I could almost smell the vineyard and see the  villa.  Totally trannsported!
title: Transported to the Beautiful Italian Vineyards

author: Elizabeth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2021
review_content: This was a wonderful read. I’ve not read this author before.Talk about prolific. So glad I found her.The characters were so real. I liked certain ones more than others, but they were all very human. I intended to spend this morning in my garden but I had to finish this story.There were parts that had me  thinking about my own life. The good , and the not so good. But this was not a bad self reflecting thing.It left me wanting to enjoy more of this authors books. It left me feeling happy. I want to visit the vineyards in Tuscany.
title: I want to visit Tuscany

author: jsvb21
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021
review_content: 3.25. Just ok.  In my opinion nothing deep or thought provoking. An interesting tale of loss, love, secrets and family relationships.  The setting in a winery in Tuscany was divine and the author did a good job in making one really feel immersed in that part of Italy, with the culture, the land, the wine, and the food.  However, this novel seemed more in the lines of a Harlequin novel and way too contrived for my liking.
title: Just ok

author: Bookworm426
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2021
review_content: Secrets, secrets, secrets. This was a pleasant read and I enjoyed the flashbacks between mother and daughter. But it felt a bit like a 30-minute television program. Girl travels to Italy and solves a multitude of mysteries in a matter of a week.Spoiler: Personally I struggled with so many infidelities. But I also personally appreciated Fiona's effort to understand and forgive others' struggles and lies.
title: Easy read

author: Kathryn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2021
review_content: Very much enjoyed this book!  Took a few chapters to grab me, but once it did, I could hardly put it down! Warm characters & beautiful descriptions of the land made me want to go to Italy.  I was glad the romance scenes weren't borderline porn.  I definitely recommend this book for an enjoyable, easy read.  I read it over a long holiday weekend.  I look forward to reading more of this author's books!
title: Lovely book!

author: Survivor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2021
review_content: Being captivated from the first page was totally not what I expected. To see the love between Lillian and Anton grow, no matter how hard it was to fight was a page turner. Freddie was a very selfish person and to see him grow even more so wasn’t a surprise. For Fiona to learn what real love existed between her biological parents and then the type of guilt love her “Dad” and mom had kept me reading every chance I could. Truly a great read
title: Regrets

author: Marib234
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021
review_content: I don't write a lot of reviews, but I do read a lot of books. This one left me feeling like I want to let everyone know what a marvelous story this was. I became totally involved, so that I would wonder what was going to happen next, even when I was going about my day.... and the backdrop of the Tuscany vineyard was just lovely.  It's one of the better books I have ever read, thus my decision to write a review. I highly recommend reading this book.
title: Wonderful story.... and setting

author: Chris Shockley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021
review_content: When the weather warms up I look for a couple of "summer" books. These tend toward simple easy to read books that aren't intense or overly complicated. Something to enjoy in the backyard after work or on the weekend.This story fits the bill for what I wanted.I liken it to A Good Year in overall setting and atmosphere. Light and casual.Warm air, sunshine and a good book. Perfect.
title: Fun summer read.

author: Jan of Queens
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
review_content: I love the writings of this author but somehow this book does not grab me. Sorry.
title: Love this author but

author: wendy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2021
review_content: The characters were believable and the story line exciting. I found myself reading (on my kindle app) everytime I had a few quiet minutes and well into the night.  There are no raunchy scenes or bad language, which I appreciate.
title: Very enjoyable read!

author: Flo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2021
review_content: I don't usually review books. I'm an avid reader, but our opinions about books are so eclectic, it didn't seem helpful. Well ! This book was a great read. I never heard of this author before, will be sure to go look and see if she has any other books on offer. This book was free for me in the Amazon Reads programs, I didn't buy it. If you enjoy a good read, I'd suggest that you do :-)
title: Amazon Reads offering, A+

author: desertsand
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2021
review_content: This is my first book by this author and I do not typically write reviews. Although I am retired I read mostly as a wind-down for sleep. This book kept me engaged and awake much longer than typical and found myself thinking about the characters throughout my day. The setting, the characters and MacLean's writing style were so enjoyable that I will definitely read more of her books.
title: Most enjoyable!

author: Ellen Zellinger
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2021
review_content: Although, I am an avid reader, I haven't written a review before. I was between the more intense books I read for my book club and was looking for something enjoyable to read. These Tangled Vines was a great pick. I really enjoyed how the author went back and forth between characters and time .At the end,  I found myself concerned that Lillian and Anton didn't get to experience the  lifetime of love that they could have. I wished this was a book club pick because I wanted to discuss how the different characters would feel . Always a sign of a good book!
title: Great , relaxing read!

author: Sandy K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
review_content: Very good story in a beautiful setting with a diverse cast of character personalities & changing circumstances ...some of whom & which many of us can relate to from having similar relationships & experiences in our own lives. Well written...drew you in from the beginning & kept you engaged in the story until the end. Throughly enjoyed reading this “hard to put down” story.
title: A Timeless Tale of Love & Loss

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2021
review_content: Love comes in many forms and this author obviously understands that. They grow gaining strength from each other, sometimes break, but go on from the source in the earth, or soul. Youth does not fully understand. Forgiveness comes hard but the alternative hardness  breeds worse cruelty.  It was hard to put this book down. I liked it very much for the reality of the various characters and the rarity  of true love and timeliness to treasure it.
title: Entangled in Love

author: JV
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021
review_content: This was an Amazon First Reads selection.  This book was so good book that I couldn’t put down!  The plot was interesting with little twists along the way.  I kept thinking I knew what was going to happen next, but I didn’t!  The characters were all complex and flawed which made them all believable.  At one point I actually got teary-eyed which is rare for me. I’ll be reading more of Julianne MacLean’s books!
title: So good!

author: Zanner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2021
review_content: I really liked this book for very distinct descriptions and a smooth flow. The plot was really interesting.  One drawback was the emotional descriptions were too simplistic. Like a cheap romance novel. Those areas fortunately didn't last long.  The whole book was relaxing to me,  no one hanging off a cliff, no guns or knives.Really good ethics displayed.
title: Relaxing read

author: glalley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2021
review_content: Having been to Italy and Tuscany in particular it was easy to slip into the sunsets,fireflies and gracious people, early mornings, Depth of human emotion and amazing culinary exploits.  But, this novel also addresses loyalty, selfishness, and forgiveness. I hope you enjoy this ride as much as I did. Hoorah to this author for creating a book of many values.
title: Who can resist a novel involving Tuscany, wine, vineyards and love

author: Patricia L. Sands
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2021
review_content: Julianne MacLean takes us into the heart of life in Tuscany with this intriguing story of deception, lies and discovery. As the truth unfolds in two different timelines, readers are swept into a world of passionate love revealed after decades of secrecy. Combined with wine, pasta and the stunning Tuscan countryside, this is a journey to savour. Va bene!
title: Finding the truth in Tuscany

author: Marsha Jeanne Thalleen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2021
review_content: These Tangled Vines by Julianne MacLeanThis is my first read from Julianne MacLean and it was very good.  It was well plotted, well casted, and well written.  I enjoyed the time jumps and the different POVs, tragedy not withstanding.  I did fell a bit let down by the Epilogue...I still have so many questions...but otherwise really well done.
title: Good

author: ZenKat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2021
review_content: Secrets morph and change.  Keeping secrets caused more problems than keeping them.  Not only is it stressful keeping them, but they are often misunderstood.  This book is about love, winemaking, Tuscany, and relationships. Celebrate your relationships knowing none of them is ideal.  Embrace your family, understand everyone has faults, and look forward.
title: This book Makes me want to open the for on Italian red

author: Amazon Customer. cathy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2021
review_content: Loved the location in Italy because I have been there. The love story was beautiful but her husband was selfish and one could understand how she fell in love with Anton. The story was believable except his accident could have happened another way and the outcome would have been the same.  Once I started reading I could not stop . Great read for mr.
title: Once you start you can't put it down.

author: Bookworm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2021
review_content: What really makes us do what we do? Why do we keep secrets? Why are we dishonest with ourselves? With those we love? Live is too short! Love is the most important , most precious and sometimes, the most elusive thing in our lives! This was a beautiful, bittersweet, story of self-imposed  consequences, understanding, forgiveness and moving forward!
title: Beautiful story of love, betrayal and redemption!

author: Jennifer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021
review_content: Fiona learns of the passing of her biological father and travels to Italy for the reading of the will.  Upon arriving in Tuscany she uncovers the history  not only of the vineyard but of her biological father and the parents that raised her.  Beautiful descriptions and well developed characters along with touching moments of love and forgiveness.
title: Unique and heartfelt

author: Booklover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2021
review_content: I enjoyed this story very much. The Tuscan setting adds charm to a book with engaging characters. Ironically, one character is a writer who feels compelled to research locations for his book, but the real author obviously failed to check out Tallahassee, Florida. She writes of Tallahassee beach scenes and it is not near water. Ooops
title: Very enjoyable

author: Kathy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2021
review_content: Lots of heavy stuff to read and deal with for this story. Complexity evident for that is how we  humans are, but description of characters and beautiful Tuscany very evident and well written. Story is very detailed and thought out. This is one of the more compassionate reads I've had in the past 6 years. Well done, Julianne!
title: Heavy, but rewarding read

author: frizabee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2021
review_content: Once again Julianne MacLean has written a novel filled with love, deception, forgiveness, promise and hope mostly set under the Tuscan sun!  Julianne's ability to weave a well crafted storyline filled with memorable characters set in gorgeous venues shines throughout this tangled web of vines!Hard to put down!!!
title: Tangled is an Understatement!

author: J.Clark
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2021
review_content: I have always enjoyed reading this author! This book I believe is one of her best. It was an honest book. Many life lessons but told in an amazing story of life, love, secrets and so much more! You most likely will not regret  taking the time to read and enjoy these fascinating characters. Thank you again Julianne MacLean!
title: EXCELLENT, BEAUTIFUL

author: Chi-lover
